chapter.title: CVS Repository
chapter.text:
The current development is kept in CVS. The CVS has read-only access for all users. Get a CVS client from cvshome.org and type:
CVSROOT=:pserver:anoncvs@cvs.sophics.cz:/var/repos export CVSROOT cvs login
When it asks you for a password enter:
anoncvs
Then type:
cvs -z3 co aranym
This will create the aranym folder in your current directory. Anytime later you can go into that folder and type
cvs -z3 update
for updating your source tree to be in sync with the master tree.
Note: The -z3 sets the compression level - the higher the number the higher the compression.
Please keep in mind that the CVS version may not always work correctly, may be unpredictable, etc. The CVS version is a development version and should be treated as such.
